"A.D.2028/3/23/10:00": "Haah..."
"Now, now, Hitsugi! It's unbecoming for the most promising Student Council Presidential Candidate to heave sighs in the presence of the students."
"It's alright, I'm not the president yet!"
"And look who's talking, Miss Vice Presidential Candidate, Washinomiya Kohri."
"N-no, don't flatter me! I don't deserve it! I'm just a simple Student Council member!"
"Hey, Kohri.... Why don't you be the Council President instead?"
"I'm not used to that type of stuff. Besides, everybody here thinks that you're the better fit for the role!"
"They do, huh? Since we're all members of the Mother Cluster, it feels just like another scramble to the top."
"Come on, Hitsugi! You don't have to say it like that."
"Competition is good, right? You're all the chosen members of Mother Cluster after all."
"...Are you planning to reject the Council President position, Hitsugi?"
"I don't mind taking the position if you don't want it, Hitsugi. But I'll support you regardless."
"No, that's not it... ...*sigh*"
"By the way, I didn't see you in PSO2 yesterday. What were you doing?"
"Hitsugi?"
"Hey, Kohri... What do you think \"PSO2\" is?"
"What do you mean, by \"What it is\"?"
"Exactly what it sounds like. Just... tell me what you think about it, Kohri."
"O-kay? Let's see..."
"\"PSO2 is an online game whose popularity boomed through its compatibility with the ultra high-speed communication system known as \"Ether\"."
"And through \"Ether\", the next-gen OS \"ESC-A\" is born."
"PSO2 comes as standard software installed by default on every system that operates using ESC-A."
"I don't want the textbook explanation! I mean... what is it to us?"
"\"Us\"? ...Oh! You mean, as members of the Mother Cluster. Right!"
"I see it as a game that we can play anytime, anywhere, with anyone through the Ether Infrastructure."
"Our job--as members of the \"Mother Cluster\"-- is to maintain the ESC-A OS. You know, report and fix bugs and stuff."
"To achieve that, thousands upon thousands of recruits became members of this grand organization, handling the day-to-day maintenance. Right?"
"Uh-huh! And with the integration of PSO2 in all of ESC-A's systems, there's naturally a lot of bugs to bust."
"It's really weird, though. The AI controlling the NPCs are acting really random."
"Anyway, our specific involvement with Mother Cluster is to gather information explicitly from PSO2."
"It's not like we're the only ones doing it, but if we don't work well, we'll easily fall behind the others."
"We know that PSO2 is just a game, so there's bound to be bugs..."
"...Hmm? I... think so? Well, Mother did call it \"ESC-A's bug\", after all."
"But the other day... Is that really what the game's supposed to be like? Were those people... really from the game?"
"Not to mention that monster... <%me>... and Aru..."
"...Hitsugi? Something wrong? Is it something I said? Sorry for killing the atmosphere."
"...Kohri."
" W-what?"
"Kohri, I know that you hate boys, but can you be brave for a bit and come with me? There's someone I want you to meet."
"Oh, a... male? Is it your older brother?"
"Nope."
"It's not Enga? Wait...! Could that person be...? No, it can't be...! Hitsugi!"
"Hitsugi, it's against the rules to have relationships! If the future Student Council President has someone like that, then their school life is over!"
"No, you idiot! Why would I introduce you to my boyfriend anyway?"
"So you DO have one?!"
"Of course not! Don't say it like that!"
"*siiigh*... The person I want you to meet isn't my older brother or boyfriend, okay?"
"Then who? Who is it?!"
"...My...little brother...?"
"Umm... It seems like Hitsugi has quite an interesting friend."
"I'm not saying that it's strange or anything!"
"So, there's a communication system called \"Ether\" over there."
"The organization called \"Mother Cluster\" exists..."
"To them, our world is a bug in the system..."
"...The more we listen, the less we know. We are FAR from having enough information."
